title: ATP roundup: Murray prevails in European Open 1st round
text:
Former world No. 1 Andy Murray defeated Belgium's Kimmer Coppejans 6-4, 7-6 (4) Tuesday in the first round of the European Open at Antwerp, Belgium.

Murray converted four of six break points en route to prevailing in 1 hour, 44 minutes. The Scotland native twice was a break down in the second set during his first tour-level match in Europe this year and the first time he has played in Antwerp.

Seventh-seeded Jan-Lennard Struff of Germany downed French qualifier Gregoire Barrere 6-2, 6-1 in just 44 minutes. France's Gilles Simon ousted hometown favorite Steve Darcis 6-1, 6-2.

Intrum Stockholm Open

Fifth-seeded Pablo Carreno Busta of Spain eased into the Round of 16 in Stockholm, with a 6-4, 6-3 victory over Australia's John Millman.

Carreno Busta needed 89 minutes to complete the victory, saving all four break points he faced and converting three of eight chances on Millman's serve.

The Spaniard was the only seeded player in action. Among other matches, American Sam Querrey beat Austrian qualifier Dennis Novak 7-6 (6), 6-4, and Serbia's Filip Krajinovic downed Norway's Casper Ruud 6-3, 7-5.

VTB Kremlin Cup

Sixth-seeded Andrey Rublev appeased the home crowd with a 6-1, 3-6, 6-4 victory over Kazakhstan's Alexander Bublik to reach the Round of 16 in Moscow.

Rublev completed the victory in 92 minutes, coming from a break down in the deciding set. Bublik racked up 16 aces but also had 11 double faults.

The other seed in action on Tuesday, No. 8 Miomir Kecmanovic of Serbia, downed Russian qualifier Artem Dubrivnyy 6-1, 7-5 in 72 minutes.

--Field Level Media
